events.description: The Nikkei 225 Index fell 0.7% to below 54,000 on Thursday.
A broader decline in technology shares globally affecting Japanese markets.

events.event_name: Arm Holdings Licensing Sales Forecast Miss
events.description: Chip designer subsidiary Arm Holdings missed fiscal third-quarter licensing sales forecasts.
Renesas Electronics announced plans to sell its Timing business to SiTime for $3 billion.

facts.fact_text: The Nikkei 225 Index fell 0.7% to below 54,000, while the Topix Index slipped 0.1% to 3,650.

evidences.evidence_text: The Nikkei 225 Index fell 0.7% to below 54,000, while the broader Topix Index slipped 0.1% to 3,650 on Thursday

facts.fact_text: SoftBank Group shares dropped more than 6%.

evidences.evidence_text: SoftBank Group dropped more than 6% after chip designer subsidiary Arm Holdings missed fiscal third-quarter licensing sales forecasts.

facts.fact_text: Panasonic shares surged as much as 15.2%.

evidences.evidence_text: Meanwhile, Panasonic surged as much as 15.2% despite lowering its full-year profit estimates

facts.fact_text: Renesas Electronics is selling its Timing business to SiTime for $3 billion.

evidences.evidence_text: Renesas Electronics gained 5% after announcing plans to sell its Timing business to SiTime for $3 billion.

claims.claim_text: Investors pulled back from technology shares due to concerns about valuations, AI spending, and software business model disruption.

evidences.evidence_text: Investors pulled back from technology shares over concerns about elevated valuations, heavy AI spending, and the potential disruption to traditional software business models.

evidence.evidence_text: extending losses from the previous session amid a global tech selloff.
SoftBank Group dropped more than 6% after chip designer subsidiary Arm Holdings missed fiscal third-quarter licensing sales forecasts.
Investors pulled back from technology shares over concerns about elevated valuations, heavy AI spending
Renesas Electronics gained 5% after announcing plans to sell its Timing business to SiTime for $3 billion.
